task.title: How do I search based on text I have selected?

uicontrol.#tail: feature to find all the documents that contain text that is similar to text you have selected in a document from your results.  The search will be based on relevant terms in the passage you select, and can help you find other documents related to a topic you are researching.

step.cmd: In an open document, use your mouse to select the text you want to base your search on.  You can select up to 1,000 characters. A menu appears with options for working with the selected text.

info.note: There is no minimum amount of text you can select, but you should select text containing the search terms that are important to your research.

uicontrol.#tail: dialog box appears, displaying the text you selected.

cmd.#text: The filters you used for the original search are displayed.  You can use the same filters or click

step.cmd: Select from the Category, Jurisdictions, and Practice Areas and Topics filters if you wish to change these options.

info.note: Changing these options also changes them in the search box at the top of the results page.

note.#text: If you select more than 1,000 characters, you'll see a notice displaying the first 1,000 characters of the text you selected, so you can review the text to ensure that it contains your relevant search terms.
